dict.string: This great pub is the focal point of the Temple Bar area. A truly historic pub with live traditional music daily, excellent oysters and whiskies, loads of old world style snugs and crannies, superb heated beer garden and excellent atmosphere and service.

Shebeen Chic is a vibrant new addition to the Dublin scene, and is making a name for itself on many fronts. Music offerings vary from trad sessions to jazz, with live comedy and DJs thrown in for good measure. Also the venue for a regular flea market, and building an appreciative audience for its traditional Irish food offering.

The Foggy Dew was made famous by the Dubliners, and many a dubliner will attest to it's enduring attraction. Live music on a saturday night, with DJs seeing out the night Thursday thru Sunday. Go there for the jingle and the jangle.

The International Bar is a lot of things to a lot of people. There is live comedy seven nights a week, live music ranging from R&B to trad on a Sunday afternoon, along with live theatre and occasional poetry and songwriting.
JJ Smyths is the place to go for live jazz and blues. The upstairs venue hosts live music 6 nights a week. One for the discerning client.
A great live music venue in the heart of Temple Bar. There is a rock focus in the bar, with no cover, cheap drink and an energetic crowd. Weekends are always busy, and the atmosphere can get heated!
A dedicated new music hub, this recent addition to the Dublin live music circut also boasts DJs, comedy, local art exhibitions and even a flea market on a Saturday afternoon.

A distinct cultural space, the Sugar Club exists to give voice to the overflowing creative talents of the city, hosting comedy, film, design, animation, theatre and of course live music. Eclectic selection, never fails to entertain.

The place to go for counter culture live music, with big international names frequently on offer. Advance ticketing sometimes required. Lineup never disappoints, so if you want a big gig, this is worth a look.

The Village is one of the heavy hitters on the live music circuit, and never fails to keep the locals interested with the program. The venue has grown over the years, in line with its reputation, and now offers a trad music venue front of house, and a concert venue which turns into a night club at the rear of house.
